troubleshooting.title: Troubleshooting Engine Misfiring Due to Dirty Carburetor
troubleshooting.shortdesc: Diagnose and resolve engine misfiring and performance issues caused by dirt in the carburetor's spraying nozzle.

ul.li: Engine begins to misfire at high speeds
Motor slows down after reaching considerable speed
Dirt or debris becomes lodged in the carburetor's spraying nozzle
Increased suction at high speeds draws particles into the nozzle
The small orifice becomes partially or fully blocked by foreign matter

step.cmd: Open the valve needle half a turn
Pull the throttle lever quickly 2-3 times
step.info: This action may help draw the dirt through the system

step.cmd: Return the valve needle to its original position
step.stepresult: If successful, normal engine operation should resume

step.cmd: If the above steps do not resolve the issue, drain the carburetor completely
step.info: Complete draining is necessary when dirt cannot be cleared through normal operation
